trans-unit.source: Note: The above pip method should work for most users. If a user encounters any installation problems including import errors or warnings, please refer to the Wiki page for possible solutions.
trans-unit.target: Note: The above pip method should work for most users. If a user encounters any installation problems including import errors or warnings, please refer to the Wiki page for possible solutions.

trans-unit.source: A tree-based parallel surrogate optimization algorithm for optimizing noisy expensive functions
trans-unit.target: ノイズの多い高価な関数を最適化するための木ベースの並列サロゲート最適化アルゴリズム

trans-unit.source: After having successfully installed the prosrs package, users are ready to use ProSRS algorithm for solving optimization problems. The easiest way of getting started is to read the tutorials in the examples directory, where different usages, from the basic level to the advanced level, are demonstrated through code examples. Of course, users are also encouraged to check out the source codes of the algorithm in the prosrs directory.
trans-unit.target: After having successfully installed the prosrs package, users are ready to use ProSRS algorithm for solving optimization problems. The easiest way of getting started is to read the tutorials in the examples directory, where different usages, from the basic level to the advanced level, are demonstrated through code examples. Of course, users are also encouraged to check out the source codes of the algorithm in the prosrs directory.

trans-unit.source: Compared to the popular Bayesian optimization algorithms, ProSRS is able to achieve faster convergence on some difficult benchmark problems, and is orders of magnitude cheaper to run. Moreover, ProSRS enjoys asymptotic convergence gaurantees. The common applications of this algorithm include efficient hyperparamter tuning of machine learning models and characterizing expensive simulation models.
trans-unit.target: 一般的なベイズ最適化アルゴリズムと比較して、ProSRSはいくつかの困難なベンチマーク問題でより速い収束を達成することができ、実行コストも桁違いに安いです。さらに、ProSRSは漸近的な収束を保証します。このアルゴリズムの一般的なアプリケーションには、機械学習モデルの効率的なハイパーパラメタチューニングや、高価なシミュレーションモデルの特性評価などがあります。

trans-unit.source: Extending the original work to the noisy setting (i.e., an objective function corrupted with random noise) through the development of a radial basis regression procedure.
trans-unit.target: 放射状基底回帰手順の開発を通じて、オリジナルの研究をノイズの多い設定(すなわち、ランダムノイズで破壊された目的関数)に拡張しました。

trans-unit.source: Getting started
trans-unit.target: 始めるには

trans-unit.source: Implementing a new SRS that combines the two types of candidate points that were originally proposed in the SRS work.
trans-unit.target: SRS作業で当初提案されていた2種類の候補点を組み合わせた新SRSの実装。

trans-unit.source: Installation
trans-unit.target: インストール

trans-unit.source: Introducing a new tree-based technique, known as the "zoom strategy", for efficiency improvement.
trans-unit.target: 効率化のための「ズーム戦略」と呼ばれる新しいツリー型の手法をご紹介します。

trans-unit.source: Introducing weighting to the regression for exploitation enhancement.
trans-unit.target: 搾取強化のための回帰に重み付けを導入。

trans-unit.source: ProSRS algorithm
trans-unit.target: プロSRSアルゴリズム

trans-unit.source: ProSRS algorithm is configured in a master-worker structure, where in each optimization iteration, the algorithm (master) constructs a RBF surrogate using the available evaluations, then proposes new points based on the constructed RBF, and finally distributes the tasks of evaluating these points to parallel processes (workers).
trans-unit.target: ProSRSアルゴリズムはマスター・ワーカー構造で構成されており、各最適化イテレーションでは、アルゴリズム(マスター)が利用可能な評価を使用してRBFサロゲートを構築し、構築したRBFに基づいて新しいポイントを提案し、最後にこれらのポイントを評価するタスクを並列プロセス(ワーカー)に分配します。

trans-unit.source: Progressive Stochastic Response Surface (ProSRS) is a parallel surrogate-based optimization algorithm for optimizing noisy expensive functions. This algorithm utilizes a radial basis function (RBF) as the surrogate, and adopts stochastic response surface (SRS) framework to balance exploitation and exploration. Compared to the original parallel SRS work, the novelties of this algorithm include
trans-unit.target: Progressive Stochastic Response Surface (ProSRS) is a parallel surrogate-based optimization algorithm for optimizing noisy expensive functions. This algorithm utilizes a radial basis function (RBF) as the surrogate, and adopts stochastic response surface (SRS) framework to balance exploitation and exploration. Compared to the original parallel SRS work, the novelties of this algorithm include
